treatment.description: Basal leaves sometimes present in rosettes at flowering, proximalmost cauline petiolate, usually withering by flowering, not 3-nerved. Heads in axillary clusters or in terminal thyrsiform arrays, not nodding or secund. Phyllaries sometimes striate, not stipitate-glandular. Pappus bristles usually in 2 series (inner bristles usually moderately clavate).
treatment.global_distribution: e North America (shaded woods and thickets).

references.reference: Cook, R. E. 2002. A Biosystematic Study of Solidago Subsect. Glomeruliflorae Torr. & Gray. (Asteraceae: Astereae) in Eastern North America. Ph.D. dissertation. University of Waterloo.
